Class SpinQubitDecoherence

java.lang.Object
org.jscience.apps.physics.spintronics.SpinQubitDecoherence
public class SpinQubitDecoherence extends Object
Spin Qubit Decoherence Simulation for quantum spintronics.

Models the loss of quantum coherence in spin qubits due to environmental interactions. Key decoherence mechanisms include:

  • T1 relaxation (spin-lattice, energy decay)
  • T2 dephasing (spin-spin, phase randomization)
  • T2* inhomogeneous broadening

Bloch-Redfield Theory

The density matrix evolution follows: $$ \frac{d\rho}{dt} = -\frac{i}{\hbar}[H, \rho] + \mathcal{L}[\rho] $$ where $\mathcal{L}$ is the Lindblad superoperator.

References

  • Loss, D. invalid input: '&' DiVincenzo, D. P. (1998). "Quantum computation with quantum dots". Physical Review A, 57(1), 120. DOI: 10.1103/PhysRevA.57.120
  • Hanson, R. et al. (2007). "Spins in few-electron quantum dots". Reviews of Modern Physics, 79(4), 1217. DOI: 10.1103/RevModPhys.79.1217
Since:
1.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

  • Constructor Details

    • SpinQubitDecoherence

      public SpinQubitDecoherence(Real t1, Real t2, Real temperature, Real magneticField)
      Creates a spin qubit decoherence simulator.
      Parameters:
      t1 - T1 relaxation time (s)
      t2 - T2 dephasing time (s)
      temperature - Environment temperature (K)
      magneticField - External magnetic field (T)

  • Method Details

    • initializeState

      public void initializeState(double theta, double phi)
      Initializes qubit in a superposition state. |ψ⟩ = cos(θ/2)|↑⟩ + e^(iφ)sin(θ/2)|↓⟩
      Parameters:
      theta - Polar angle (radians)
      phi - Azimuthal angle (radians)

    • applyGate

      public void applyGate(char axis, double angle)
      Applies a single-qubit gate (rotation on Bloch sphere).
      Parameters:
      axis - Rotation axis ('X', 'Y', 'Z')
      angle - Rotation angle (radians)

    • evolve

      public void evolve(Real dt)
      Evolves the qubit state under decoherence for a time step. Uses Lindblad master equation approximation.
      Parameters:
      dt - Time step (s)

    • measureZ

      public int measureZ()
      Performs a projective measurement in the Z basis.
      Returns:
      0 for |↓⟩, 1 for |↑⟩

    • calculateFidelity

      public Real calculateFidelity(Real targetSx, Real targetSy, Real targetSz)
      Calculates the fidelity with respect to a target state.
      Parameters:
      targetSx - Target ⟨σx⟩
      targetSy - Target ⟨σy⟩
      targetSz - Target ⟨σz⟩
      Returns:
      Fidelity (0 to 1)

    • calculatePurity

      public Real calculatePurity()
      Calculates the purity of the quantum state. γ = Tr(ρ²) = (1 + |s|²) / 2
      Returns:
      Purity (0.5 for maximally mixed, 1 for pure)

    • ramseyExperiment

      public Real ramseyExperiment(Real waitTime, int numShots)
      Simulates a Ramsey experiment to measure T2*.
      Parameters:
      waitTime - Free evolution time (s)
      numShots - Number of measurements
      Returns:
      Average ⟨σx⟩ after Ramsey sequence

    • hahnEchoExperiment

      public Real hahnEchoExperiment(Real waitTime, int numShots)
      Simulates a Hahn echo experiment to measure T2.
      Parameters:
      waitTime - Total free evolution time (s)
      numShots - Number of measurements
      Returns:
      Average ⟨σx⟩ after echo sequence

      public Real getT2Star()

    • createSiliconQuantumDot

      public static SpinQubitDecoherence createSiliconQuantumDot()
      Creates a silicon quantum dot spin qubit. Si/SiGe has excellent coherence times.

    • createGaAsQuantumDot

      public static SpinQubitDecoherence createGaAsQuantumDot()
      Creates a GaAs quantum dot spin qubit. Limited by hyperfine coupling to nuclear spins.

    • createNVCenter

      public static SpinQubitDecoherence createNVCenter()
      Creates a nitrogen-vacancy (NV) center in diamond. Can operate at room temperature.
